meanings.definition: A person who nobbles or cheats.
meanings.sent1: The nobblers were caught trying to cheat in the game.
meanings.sent2: He was known as a notorious nobblers in the gambling circles.
meanings.sent3: The nobblers tried to sneak extra cards into the deck.
meanings.sent4: She was a cunning nobblers, always finding a way to deceive others.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the nobblers who lurk in the shadows of the competition.

meanings.definition: An alcoholic drink, especially a strong one.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, he enjoyed sipping on a glass of nobblers.
meanings.sent2: The bartender served a variety of nobblers to the customers.
meanings.sent3: The nobblers at the party flowed freely, making everyone merry.
meanings.sent4: She felt the warmth of the nobblers spreading through her body.
meanings.sent5: The nobblers in his hand reflected the amber glow of the setting sun.

meanings.definition: To disable or sabotage, especially in a race or competition.
meanings.sent1: He tried to nobblers his opponent's bike before the race.
meanings.sent2: The rival team attempted to nobblers our chances of winning.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon seemed to nobblers the other runners' shoes.
meanings.sent4: She felt someone trying to nobblers her progress, but she pushed on.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected rain threatened to nobblers the outdoor event.
